text: A connector between Chinatown, One Raffles and MBS for those rainy and hot days. There's niche coffee cafes for "on the go" coffees and a Cedele too. For those who want local fare, they can head to the Kopitiam on the top floor.
A new linkway connecting downtown, Raffles Place MRT stations with several newly opened restaurants. Not crowded during weekend and PH

This mall is under the Marina Bay Financial Center and because the shops serve primarily the office population, it is quite a breathe of fresh air during the weekend - none of the typical crowd like at other malls in the country as most of the retail and eateries are closed.

Connected by Downtown MRT and Raffles Place MRT (a further walk), this might be a great place to come for a meal or coffee. Starbuck and Din Tai Fung are open when I was there Saturday.

The mall is also a great space if you want to change up your jogging/walking route with immediate access to the beautiful Marina bay front and Gardens by the Bay.

Spacious and big mall. You can go here with family and friends to chill. The mall offers all the luxury brand showrooms. There is a casino as well inside the mall. If you are an outsider, please carry you passport to get entry in casino.
Good spacious mall and  all shops are refined with display and offers
